attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I am a mature adult who has not smoked since 2002, but I enjoy a couple of pints of Real Ale most days and have done so for many years. Since draught Real Ale reached £2.00 a pint I have become an infrequent visitor to pubs. I now buy from supermarkets whatever bottled or canned Real Ale is currently the best discounted offer, just so that I can have a quiet relaxing drink at home.
The excessive hike in alcohol duties following the 2008 Budget is not just targeting young idiot binge drinkers, but ALL DRINKERS!! It is purely a Puritanical Nanny State Revenue producing operation, that will continue what the smoking ban has started by killing-off local community pubs. I started drinking in pubs in 1972, the price of a pint of beer then was 20p, and it should be no more than £1.00 now!
As well as threatening the existence of local community pubs, small traditional Real Ale breweries will be forced to close, losing jobs and a vital part of our culture and heritage.
Why not double the duty on alco-pops instead?
